itemDescription: British lecturer and Labour Party politician (1927-1995)

wikipedia_page.main: Joseph Trevor Park (12 December 1927 – 6 April 1995) was a British lecturer and politician. He was a Labour Party Member of Parliament during Harold Wilson's government in the 1960s, a government which he regarded as unhelpful to the interests of Labour voters.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1964 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the 1966 United Kingdom general election

response: * Trevor Park (1927–95), former MP for South East Derbyshire

After the station closed on 1 January 1968, Trevor Park MP for South East Derbyshire raised a complaint to Sir Edmund Compton, Parliamentary Commissioner. By the time the commissioner had made a ruling in September 1968, the station had already been demolished. The North Curve was also removed, in spite of much local opposition. The route of Fields Farm Road now uses the trackbed of the former curve. The name Trent remains however, perpetuated on the Power Signal Box built in 1969.
Jackson did not contest the seat at the 1964 general election, when Trevor Park won South East Derbyshire for Labour. Jackson never returned to the House of Commons.
* Trevor Park (1927–1995), Labour MP for South East Derbyshire, 1964–1970
